intro: Bolanthus huber-morathii, commonly known as the Morath's bolanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and exhibits a compact, shrub-like structure. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bolanthus huber-morathii is considered a species of conservation concern.
